titleStmt.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Dear Ones, January 18, 1934
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, John G.

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from John G. Neihardt to Dear Ones, January 18, 1934

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw: ABSOLUTELY FIREPROOF Comstock Hotel FRANK F. DUNLAP PROPR. Thursday, 8 a.m. MOORHEAD, MINN.
div1.p: Had a fine time yesterday in Minneapolis's. Everybody well there. Went to see A. J. Russell at the Journal. He, Neil & I had lunch together at Shicks. It was bully to feel old Russell again, & he was as glad as I. You will remember that my old boyhood pal, "Dick" Medical Sciences at the Minnesota University and one of the most distinguished in men in the medical world. Yesterday Mrs. Scammon called Lulu (after a deuce of a time tracing her) and invited all of us to dinner Sunday evening. It will be great to see old Dick again Good Lord! It will be hard to call him Doctor! I think I won't do it. Then Teena will have us to the Ritzy place of Minneapolis for another.
div1.fw: ABSOLUTELY FIREPROOF Comstock Hotel FRANK F. DUNLAP PROPR. Thursday, 8 a.m. MOORHEAD, MINN._______________________
div1.p: eating Saturday evening. My coming to Moorhead was in the Minneapolis papers. Last evening Lulu, the two boys & I went to the Orpheum to want for my 10:50 train to Moorhead - the saw & heard Kate Smith in person. Mona, she is a moose and sings like a lark with a powerful but clear & sweet & flexible voice. This seems impossible, I know But that noise we heard was certainly not Kate Smith. Everybody seems to love her - big fat, active thing with a warm heart. A bit coarse in action, but a wonderful voice. I had a good night. Got here at 7:30 a.m. It's not cold here - just a bit nippy, although I am is is as far North as Duluth. This is the country where Mrs. Holsen grew up. The Red River is close.
div1.fw: ABSOLUTELY FIREPROOF Comstock Hotel FRANK F. DUNLAP PROPR. Thursday, 8 a.m. MOORHEAD, MINN._______________________
div1.p: Have just seen a Prof. from the College. Very nice & very cordial It's to be quite an affair, & has been armourred in the Fargo daily as "the oustanding event" of the season. I remarked that much would defend upon the quality of the rest of it! By Donald & I are really good friends. He & I both know it without trying. They weren't that we drive up here in the answer & on up into the North Woods. We may, too. I love this dry snappy air. It gives & is not at all hard to stand. Minneapolis was about the same as here. Snow all the way worth of Des Moines.

closer.salute: Endless love for all four of you
